content:
Sure, here are updated versions of the storyboards that include the additional music equipment you mentioned:

"The Music Mashup Showcase"

Introduction:

* Introduce yourself and explain the purpose of the show: showcasing music mashups
* Mention the theme of the show: "The Music Mashup Showcase"

Segment 1: Music mashup demonstrations

* Show how you create a music mashup using your equipment (e.g., Roland Go:Livecast, Tascam Model 12, Native Instruments, Komplete Kontrol, Akai MPC Live 2)
* Offer tips and tricks for creating effective music mashups
* Use the face-on camera to show your hands as you work
* Use the overhead camera to show a bird's-eye view of your equipment

Segment 2: Music mashup reviews

* Review music mashups created by other musicians or producers
* Offer feedback and suggestions for improvement
* Use the face-on camera to show your reactions as you listen to the music mashups

Segment 3: Music mashup challenges

* Challenge your audience to create their own music mashups and share them with you
* Offer feedback and suggestions for improvement
* Use the face-on camera to show your reactions as you listen to the music mashups

Conclusion:

* Summarize the key points from the show
* Thank your audience for participating in the challenges
* Mention when the next show will be and invite your audience to tune in

"The Music Mashup Masterclass"

Introduction:

* Introduce yourself and explain the purpose of the show: offering tips and tricks for creating music mashups
* Mention the theme of the show: "The Music Mashup Masterclass"

Segment 1: Music mashup demonstrations

* Show how you create a music mashup using your equipment
